The specified value has been assigned to a stack location.

Load or store it there, with appropriate extension if necessary.

### getStackAddress() {#a18bab7a0c4783a00f51d05cae58ee7da}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Register anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;AArch64CallLowering.cpp&#125;::IncomingArgHandler::getStackAddress (uint64&#95;t MemSize, int64&#95;t Offset, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> &amp; MPO, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/isd/argflagsty">ISD::ArgFlagsTy</a> Flags)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Materialize a VReg containing the address of the specified stack-based object.

This is either based on a FrameIndex or direct SP manipulation, depending on the context. <code>MPO</code> should be initialized to an appropriate description of the address created.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/lib/target/aarch64/gisel/aarch64calllowering-cpp/#l00142">142</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/lib/target/aarch64/gisel/aarch64calllowering-cpp">AArch64CallLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getStackValueStoreType() {#ad743c42316a13699646a3ed402aab910}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLT anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;AArch64CallLowering.cpp&#125;::IncomingArgHandler::getStackValueStoreType (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp; DL, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ccvalassign">CCValAssign</a> &amp; VA, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/isd/argflagsty">ISD::ArgFlagsTy</a> Flags) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Return the in-memory size to write for the argument at <code>VA</code>.

This may be smaller than the allocated stack slot size.

This is overridable primarily for targets to maintain compatibility with hacks around the existing DAG call lowering infrastructure.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/lib/target/aarch64/gisel/aarch64calllowering-cpp/#l00157">157</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/lib/target/aarch64/gisel/aarch64calllowering-cpp">AArch64CallLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### markRegUsed() {#a45283b7afd1fedab0d97f3c8e9b2b47c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual void anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;AArch64CallLowering.cpp&#125;::IncomingArgHandler::markRegUsed (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> Reg)</>}>
How the physical register gets marked varies between formal parameters (it&#39;s a basic-block live-in), and a call instruction (it&#39;s an implicit-def of the BL).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/lib/target/aarch64/gisel/aarch64calllowering-cpp/#l00210">210</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/lib/target/aarch64/gisel/aarch64calllowering-cpp">AArch64CallLowering.cpp</a>.
